pros:
-Dedicated space at Dawson to tutor tutees.
-No need to move, sessions can be directly after classes
-Flexible hours (discussed and agreed upon with tutee)
-Feeling great when someone succeeds from your help
-Gain experience in communication and explaining 
 complex information in a simple enough way
cons:
-Cannot guarantee tutee showing up, no compensation, wasted wait time, not worth for minimum wage
-Not competive salary (Maisonneuve was offering $20/h to its students the same year)

job_title: Administrative Support Agent in Montreal, QC
pros:
Good salary 
Nice work environment if you like being in a College
Well situated (Montreal downtown) 
Good coworkers
cons:
Managers don’t encourage your growth 
Changing positions can be competitive

pros: good to do with studies
cons: there is no cons tbh

pros: dynamic place to work around young people
cons: parking is hard to find

pros:
Dawson is the type of workplace that has a sense of community. This gives staff a feeling of acceptance but that does not stifle innovation or inspiration. Teachers try new things. Innovative projects are encouraged, many of them involving staff from different job categories. Budgets are made available for as many of these types of projects as possible. 
Students always come first, and that is what holds everyone together. 
On the whole, it is a stimulating place to work.
cons:
The size of the college can sometimes be a bit overwhelming - 8000 students and 1000+ teachers/staff is a lot of people in one building; but this can also be exhilarating and certainly being surrounded by young people keeps one young. 
Budget cuts and government bureaucratic rules can be a bit stifling, but they are the reality in most workplaces these days.

pros: The students are wonderful young people, full of energy and hope. Many of the teaching staff are highly competent and caring. As a teacher, you are in large part given the freedom to approach the material in the way that best suits the specific needs of your students.
cons: The administration is quite distant, .Small, highly respected programs can easily become victim to the creeping technocratisation of education, or the whims of department chairs intent on affirming their power and authority. The deans often seem more interested in applying policy than in doing what is best for students.

review_title: Intellectual Freedom and The Best Colleagues ever
pros: The community life at Dawson College is wonderful. So many of the teachers are spearheading incredible projects both in the school and in the community. On the level of the courses, the teachers regularly pursue new and innovative material, and the students work hard!
cons: For those who work full-time, there are no cons. For those in Continuing Education, however, the pay, benefits, and working conditions are miserable. This is the fault of the government, but Dawson should advocate on their behalf.

review_title: Could be great but is stuck in old management style
pros: Interacting with young people, having a privileged role in their lives, some interesting coworkers, month off in summer.
cons: Absolutely archaic management style, very traditional, keep managers/teachers/staff that are not at their place and hurt reputation and professional well being of others, Union is all show but no action, no advancement and no room for creative change. Often told  "this is the way it has always been done".

pros: Exciting Environment; interesting people; amazing management; great conditions; working with young people
cons: Unprofessional union; people who have worked here too long and lost respect for the educational process and appreciation for what they have;

pros:
-Nice co-workers
-nice inclusive events
-open and transparent teacher's union
- Decent hourly wage
cons:
- not paid for anything but lecture hours (not paid for grading, lesson/test prep, office hours, etc..)
- no job security (I don't even know if I'll be assigned a course next semester)
- no health insurance or benefits of any kind
- no sick days

pros: Awesome work environment, great colleagues, helpful, considerate overall environment of the college, wonderful students, many interesting programs for teachers and all,
cons: None so far that i know :) and i have been teaching there for 15 years! I am just hoping that teacher and all at the college are always paid fairly and hope we can fight austerity.

review_title: Evaluation of working at Dawson College
pros: Excellent premises, helpful staff, friendly atmosphere, choice of subject matter to teach
cons: Long hours marking and grading students' work. No other cons.
